Hello from the NMR team at Synex Medical! We're developing a miniaturized health monitor that can measure critical blood metabolites non-invasively. That technology is based on novel techniques we’ve developed in magnetic resonance.
We're on track to deliver our MVP (Minimum Viable Product) by the end of 2021, which will measure glucose and lactate non-invasively. We are gearing up for some big milestones (series A, clinical validation, MVP delivery).

Post-processing and analyzing NMR spectra using an in-house developed platform
Improving and expanding our data analysis and visualization platform
Identifying and developing advanced algorithms to tackle unique low-field MRS challenges including denoising, spectral deconvolution, and post-processing corrections
Leveraging SOTA machine learning methods to improve processing and analysis of in vivo magnetic resonance spectra.
Developing robust approaches for the accurate quantification of in vivo metabolite concentrations
Because we're still in research and development mode, we're looking for someone that can tackle problems with creativity and an open mind. We see this role as a great opportunity for someone with an academic NMR background to break into the data science field. We also recognize that this is a unique role and that no one is likely to be perfectly qualified for it.

Thorough understanding of and experience with signal processing for NMR
Programming skills, particularly in Python, with experience using Python scientific libraries like NumPy and SciPy
Familiarity with Git for version control
Thorough understanding of machine learning and statistics

Title: Instrumentation Scientist - Edmonton, AB - Indeed.com

Our scientific, logical, and comprehensive approach to industrial and engineering challenges often leads to fundamental, lasting solutions for clients and a rewarding place to work for our employees.
A challenging opportunity exists in our Edmonton, AB facility for an Instrumentation Scientist with a Data Science background. The successful candidate will engage in advanced research and development projects over a wide range of industrial sectors and technologies.
Your Role
:
Taking responsibility for the measurement on new and existing apparatus. These apparatus range from benchtop units measuring a few parameters to warehouse-sized systems with multiple flow loops and motion control axis controlled by a central system.
Determining the physical quantities that need to be measured in an experimental system to characterize the physics
Designing the measurement system to collect data on the above. This may include:

Troubleshooting

Writing report content and memos related to the design and execution of measurement and control schemes

Data acquisition systems

Commercial instrumentation
Analytical equipment
Process equipment such as pumps, compressors, valves, motors, drives, etc.

Certified electrician

Software development
Identifying a need and making it happen

Experience troubleshooting and repairing instrumentation
